CatDescriptText: Tillie Folks, housewife, Arlington Heights and Marlene DeBeone, stenographer, East Pittsburgh, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 23, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "What do you think is the number one problem for city officials to solve in the redevelopment program?  Why?"  Mrs. Folks' answer reads: "I think that housing is the number one problem - especially housing for colored people."  Ms. DeBeone's answer reads: "I think that the smaller areas like in the outlying wards, need to be cleaned up.  If given a chance, the people there will live as well as others."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Tillie Folks wearing calico dress with ruffled collar, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Marlene DeBone wearing gingham dress with tie at waist, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
